document_title: Hyperthyroidism: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Women are 2-10 times more likely to have hyperthyroidism than men. You are more likely to get the disease if:
Have a family history of thyroid disease; Having other health problems, including: Pernicious anemia: Condition caused by vitamin B12 deficiency Type 1 diabetes Primary adrenal insufficiency, hormone disorder Consuming large amounts of foods with contain iodine, such as algae or seaweed, or use medications that contain iodine, such as amiodarone. People older than 60 years old, especially women, are at higher risk than men. Have had glandular surgery. thyroid or have thyroid problems, such as goiter.; Pernicious anemia: Condition caused by vitamin B12 deficiency; Type 1 diabetes; Primary adrenal insufficiency, hormonal disorders; Consume large amounts of foods that contain iodine, such as algae or seaweed, or use medications that contain iodine, such as amiodarone; People over 60 years old, especially women, are at higher risk of the disease than men; Have had thyroid surgery or have thyroid problems, such as goiter.
